Legal & Compliance

Home/Legal & Compliance

Property Transaction Legal Requirements

Understanding the legal framework governing real estate transactions is crucial for all parties involved. This section covers the essential legal requirements for property sales, purchases, and transfers.

  • Property registration and documentation requirements
  • Title verification and due diligence processes
  • Stamp duty and registration fee calculations
  • Legal compliance for property transfers
  • Required documentation for different property types

Documentation Requirements

Broker Gully keeps the registration process simple but requires basic documentation to maintain trust and compliance. The requirements differ slightly for Customers and Brokers:

  • For Customers: Basic ID proof (Aadhaar, PAN, Passport, or Driving License)
  • For Customers: Verified mobile number or email via OTP
  • For Customers: Profile details including name, gender, location, budget, and property preferences
  • For Brokers: Government ID proof (PAN / Aadhaar)
  • For Brokers: Address proof (utility bill, Aadhaar, or rental agreement)
  • For Brokers: Business ID / RERA Registration Number (if applicable)
  • For Brokers: Company details such as business name, region, and license number
  • For Brokers: Optional GST Number for invoicing and compliance
  • For Brokers: Bank details if payouts or subscriptions are involved

Registration Process

Getting started with Broker Gully is simple and quick. The entire signup process is designed to be secure and role-specific for both brokers and customers.

  • Go to the Broker Gully website or app and click 'Sign Up'
  • Choose your role – Broker or Customer
  • Enter your mobile number or email and receive an OTP
  • Verify OTP to confirm your identity
  • Fill in basic profile details (name, location, preferences, business info for brokers)
  • Complete registration and access your personalized dashboard
  • Brokers can start adding leads and properties; customers can browse, shortlist, and connect

Real Estate Compliance Checklist

Use this checklist to ensure your real estate transactions meet all legal requirements:

Pre-Transaction Compliance

  • ✓Verify property title and ownership
  • ✓Check for legal encumbrances
  • ✓Obtain necessary NOCs and clearances
  • ✓Verify developer's RERA registration
  • ✓Review all project documentation

Transaction Documentation

  • ✓Prepare sale deed with proper clauses
  • ✓Calculate and pay stamp duty
  • ✓Arrange for property registration
  • ✓Obtain tax clearance certificates
  • ✓Complete all required documentation

Post-Transaction Compliance

  • ✓Update property records
  • ✓Transfer utility connections
  • ✓File necessary tax returns
  • ✓Maintain transaction records
  • ✓Comply with ongoing obligations

Key Regulatory Bodies

These are the primary regulatory authorities that govern real estate practices in India. Broker Gully aligns with their guidelines to ensure trust, transparency, and compliance.

Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA)

Monitors real estate developers and brokers, ensuring transparency and protecting buyers' interests.

Website: https://rera.gov.in

Contact: State-specific RERA offices

Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs (MoHUA)

Responsible for housing policies, real estate reforms, and urban development programs across India.

Website: https://mohua.gov.in

Contact: Central Government Ministry

Income Tax Department

Regulates tax obligations related to property transactions, rental income, and capital gains.

Website: https://incometax.gov.in

Contact: Regional Income Tax Offices

State Revenue & Stamp Duty Departments

Oversee property registration, land records, and collection of stamp duty and registration fees.

Website: Varies by state

Contact: Local Sub-Registrar Offices

Data Protection Authorities

Ensure secure handling of personal and financial data in compliance with privacy laws (like DPDP Act in India).

Website: https://www.meity.gov.in

Contact: Ministry of Electronics & IT (MeitY)

Legal & Compliance FAQ

What documents are required to create an account on Broker Gully?

Customers need a basic ID proof (Aadhaar, PAN, Passport, or Driving License) along with mobile/email OTP verification. Brokers need to provide additional documents such as business/RERA ID, address proof, and company details.

Is RERA registration mandatory for brokers on Broker Gully?

Yes, in states where RERA regulations apply, brokers are required to provide their RERA registration number. This ensures trust and compliance on the platform.

Do customers need to complete KYC to browse properties?

No, customers can browse properties after completing basic profile setup and OTP verification. However, ID proof verification is recommended for connecting with brokers and accessing all features.

How are documents verified on Broker Gully?

Once documents are uploaded, the Broker Gully compliance team reviews and verifies them. Verification for brokers may take 1–2 working days.

Is my data and documentation safe on Broker Gully?

Yes, Broker Gully follows industry-standard data protection practices. All documents are stored securely with encryption and are never shared with third parties without consent.

What happens if a broker does not submit documents?

Unverified brokers will have limited access to features. Submitting complete documentation is mandatory for lead transfers, premium listings, and payouts.

Need Legal Assistance?

Our legal experts are here to help you navigate complex real estate legal requirements and ensure full compliance.
